title: Discussions held to prevent elephant intrusions at Mattala Airport
byline: Discussions have been held to address the ongoing issues concerning the perimeter fence of the Mattala Rajapaksa International Airport (MRIA) which had been damaged owing to elephant intrusions, the Ministry of Defence said in a statement.

title: Bali flights cancelled after Indonesia volcano eruption
byline: At least two dozen flights to and from the Indonesian resort island of Bali have been cancelled, its international airport website showed on Wednesday (Jun 18), after a volcano in the archipelago’s east erupted, shooting an ash tower 10km into the sky.

title: Several spells of showers expected today
byline: Showers will occur at times in the Western and Sabaragamuwa provinces and in the Nuwara-Eliya, Kandy, Galle and Matara districts today, the Department of Meteorology said.

title: Israel-Iran air war enters sixth day
byline: Iran and Israel launched new missile strikes at each other on Wednesday as the air war between the two longtime enemies entered a sixth day despite a call from U.S. President Donald Trump for Iran’s unconditional surrender.

title: J’pura Hospital neurosurgeon and two others remanded
byline: Three individuals, including a specialist neurosurgeon attached to the Sri Jayewardenepura General Hospital, who were arrested by the Commission to Investigate Allegations of Bribery or Corruption (CIABOC), have been remanded, Ada Derana reporter said.

title: Several Sri Lankans stranded in Israel due to lack of outbound flights
byline: Several Sri Lankan nationals in Israel for business purposes have been stranded due to the lack of outbound flights, the Sri Lankan Embassy in Israel has said.

title: Teen arrested over fatal accident on pedestrian crossing
byline: A teenager has been arrested following an accident along the Trincomalee – Ambepussa road in Anandakulam, Trincomalee, police stated.

title: 18 injured as bus collides with container truck in Eheliyagoda
byline: A total of 18 individuals have sustained injuries in a road accident in Eheliyagoda this morning (18), police stated.

title: Award winning Hollywood actor Jeremy Irons arrives in Sri Lanka
byline: Renowned British actor Jeremy Irons, a recipient of both Oscar and Emmy Awards, arrived at Bandaranaike International Airport (BIA) in Katunayake last night to take part in a film being shot in Sri Lanka.

title: Keheliya arrives at Bribery Commission
byline: Former Minister of Health Keheliya Rambukwella has arrived at the Commission to Investigate Allegations of Bribery or Corruption (CIABOC) to record a statement.

title: CPC stops dispensing fuel into barrels and cans
byline: The Ceylon Petroleum Corporation (CPC) has decided to suspend the issuance of fuel into cans and barrels with immediate effect.

title: Two arrested for demanding ransom of Rs. 10 mn and threatening to kill a child
byline: Two individuals have been arrested for demanding a ransom of Rs. 10 million and forcibly obtaining Rs. 2 million from an individual in Badalgama.

title: Trump to extend US TikTok ban deadline, White House says
byline: TikTok will live on for at least another three months in the United States, as President Donald Trump is poised to extend a sale or ban deadline for the third time since taking office this year.

title: Vraie Cally Balthazaar takes oath as 26th Mayor of Colombo
byline: Vraie Cally Balthazaar of the National People’s Power (NPP) has taken oaths as the 26th Mayor of the Colombo Municipal Council (CMC), a short while ago.

title: Sajith calls for Parliament debate on Israel-Iran conflict
byline: Leader of the Opposition Sajith Premadasa has requested the Speaker of House to allocate time to hold a Parliamentary debate to discuss the impact of the on-going Israel-Iran conflict.

title: Israeli tanks kill 59 people in Gaza crowd trying to get food aid, medics say
byline: Israeli tanks fired into a crowd trying to get aid from trucks in Gaza on Tuesday, killing at least 59 people, according to medics, in one of the bloodiest incidents yet in mounting violence as desperate residents struggle for food.

title: Rajeev Amarasuriya to step down from CBSL Governing Board
byline: Attorney-at-Law Rajeev Amarasuriya is scheduled to conclude his tenure as a member of the Governing Board and the Monetary Policy Board of the Central Bank of Sri Lanka (CBSL) on June 27, 2025.

title: Chinese Embassy in Sri Lanka to launch new online visa application system
byline: The Chinese Embassy in Sri Lanka has announced that it will officially launch the “China Visa Online Application System” from June 30, 2025.

title: Boossa Prison inmates protest on rooftop
byline: A total of five inmates of the Boossa Prison have launched a protest on top of the prison roof, Ada Derana reporter stated.

title: Over 100 Indian students evacuated from Iran through Armenia border
byline: India has begun the evacuation of its nationals from Iran amid the escalating tensions between Tehran and Israel.

title: NPP secures power in Kolonnawa UC; SJB gains control of Kuliyapitiya UC
byline: The National People’s Power (NPP) has established power in the Kolonnawa Urban Council.

title: FR petition over Sabaragamuwa Uni. ragging incident fixed for consideration
byline: The Supreme Court today (18) ordered that the hearing of the Fundamental Rights Petition filed by the Bar Association of Sri Lanka (BASL) which seeks a ruling that the ragging incident involving Charith Dilshan...

title: Will strive to transform Colombo into one of the most developed cities in the world – New Mayor
byline: Efforts will be taken to transform Colombo into one of the most developed cities in the world, newly appointed Mayor Vraie Cally Balthazaar said after assuming duties in the new post this morning (18).

title: California report warns of unregulated AI’s ‘irreversible harms’
byline: Without proper safeguards, powerful artificial intelligence (AI) could induce severe and ‘potentially irreversible harms,’ a report released Tuesday by California Governor Gavin Newsom warned.
